intro: Pouteria macao, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The tree produces edible seeds, known as Brazil nuts, which are enclosed in a hard, woody capsule. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires a long growing season to mature. Its ecological importance is significant, as it supports diverse wildlife and plays a role in carbon sequestration.
